items.title: SnNotSupportedException: SnLinq: ContentSet.Execute<TResult>
items.body:
We use queries like this with our project:
`SenseNet.ContentRepository.Content containerContent = SenseNet.ContentRepository.Content.All.FirstOrDefault(c => c.InTree(PortalContext.Current.Site.Path) && c.Type("ProjectContainer"));`

It'd worked safe and sound but after we've upgraded sn services from 7.0.2 to 7.1.1 the following exception appeared:
```
SnNotSupportedException: SnLinq: ContentSet.Execute<TResult>
   at SenseNet.ContentRepository.Linq.ContentSet`1.Execute[TResult](Expression expression) in E:\BuildAgent\_work\63\s\src\ContentRepository\Linq\ContentSet.cs:line 205
```

items.title: Make the OnMessageReceived virtual method proteced
items.body: The _OnMessageReceived_ method is virtual so it can be overridden - but currently only inside the assembly. By adding the ```protected``` modifier we let 3rd party devs to create a custom cluster channel implementation that reuses the logic in the built-in base class.

items.title: Road to .Net Standard
items.body: Convert sensenet code base piece-by-piece to support **.Net Standard** so that sensenet packages may be used from a .Net Core _and_ a .Net Framework application.

items.title: ContentQuery LINQ StartsWith issue
Package sandbox directory
items.body:
Currently the sandbox folder (called _run_) is created next to the package that is executed. If packages are stored in multiple folders all over in the file system (instead of a single place), these run folders are created in many different places.

### Possible solutions
1. configure a fixed sandbox folder path
2. always create the sandbox folder in the parent of SnAdmin.exe instead of the parent of the current package
3. ~always copy the package into the Admin folder and execute it from there~

items.title: [Messaging] Read-only messaging setup
items.body:
It is a valid setup when a messaging actor only wants to **receive** messages, not send them - for example because it cannot access other channels and it does not want to send messages anyway. An example is the _search service_ that should receive security messages (entity changes) but does not send anything.

In this case the system should accept a **single queue configuration**. Currently an exception is thrown if there is only 1 queue configured.

```MsmqMessageProvider, line 53```

### Acceptance
It should be OK to configure only a receiver queue. In this case when the system **tries to send** a message, it still should result in an **exception** so that the operator/developer knows that something is not right.

```xml
<add key="SecurityMsmqChannelQueueName" value=".\private$\security" />
```

items.title: [Packaging] Edit assembly bindings in config files
items.body:
Custom step: add or edit assembly bindings in web.config and snadminruntime config files.

- Should work with the **SN6** codebase
- one step adds/changes a single _dependentAssembly_ node
- there is a previous custom step that is capable of **editing**, maybe we can extend that with the add feature :  $/SenseNet/Tools/CustomPackages/SimpleCustomSteps/UpdateAssemblyBinding.cs
- if there is an existing binding: replace only if the existing version is _lower_

```xml
<CustomSteps.UpdateAssemblyBinding name="Microsoft.Owin" publickey="12314234345" newVersion="3.0.1"/>
```

items.title: Migrate configurations during sn6-sn7 upgrade
items.body:
Config sections changed since sn6 significantly.

- [ ] Web.config
- [ ] Tools\SnAdminRuntime.exe.config

The step can be something like this:
```
<?xml version="1.0" encoding="utf-8"?>
<Package>
  ...
  <Steps>
    <EditConfiguration>
      <Move>
        <Element sourceSetion="section1"
                 targetSection="sensenet/section2" />
        <Element sourceSetion="appSettings"
                 sourceKey="asdf"
                 targetSection="sensenet/section3"
                 default="42" />
        <Element sourceSetion="appSettings"
                 sourceKey="LuceneActivityTimeoutInSeconds"
                 targetSection="sensenet/indexing"
                 targetKey="IndexingActivityTimeoutInSeconds" />
        ...
      </Move>
      <Delete>
        <Element section="appSettings"
                 key="RestoreIndex" />
        ...
      </Delete>
    </EditConfiguration>
  </Steps>
</Package>```

items.title: Change type: WebContentDemo to Article
items.body:
During patching SN6 to SN7 we need to change all content of the type *WebContentDemo* to *Article*. 

> The solution (custom step?) should work with the **SN6 code base**, because WebContentDemo does not exist in SN7 - but Article does exist in SN6.

- change type to Article
- copy value of the *Header* field to the *Lead* field on the Article type

items.title: Workflow issue after IIS reset
items.body:
Workflow does not work/restart correctly after IIS reset.

**Update**: not just IIS reset but after the first iteration.
Reason: workflow status is not indexed correctly, the index contains the default 'Created' state despite we save the new 'Running' state on the node.

- [x] review ticket in JIRA and fix if necessary
- [x] release Workflow
- [x] notify stakeholders

items.title: [Packaging] Delete content type step
items.body:
It would be useful to have an SnAdmin step that is able to delete one content types from the system. 

```xml
<DeleteContentTypes names="Car" />
<DeleteContentTypes>Car</DeleteContentTypes>
```

#### This step should
- [x] delete contents of this type
- [x] delete content templates of this type
- [x] delete applications for this type
- [x] delete content views from _/Root/Global/contenetviews_ and _/Root/Skins/.../contentviews_ related to this type
- [x] remove this type from the repository where this is an _allowed type_:
  - other CTDs
  - any reference field
  - any content
- [x] delete the CTD
- [x] execute recursively
- [x] add to built-in steps docs

Extra:
- default execution shows information.
- deletion is triggered by an extra parameter.
  - **only information**: <DeleteContentType name="ContentType1" />
  - **delete anyway**: <DeleteContentType name="ContentType1" delete="force" />
  - **delete if not instantiated**: <DeleteContentType name="ContentType1" delete="ifNotUsed" />

Maybe the main logic should be developed in the **repository layer** (instead of directly in a step) so that an action can call it later if needed.

(the code will be backported into an sn6 custom step library anyway, but we should add it to the official codebase too for future use)

items.title: Search service backup
items.body:
## Goal
Letting operators create a backup of a centralized index **without downtime**.

## Proposed solution
Create a backup snapshot of the index, without pause or duplicated index folders.

0. The service is started, there is a single index directory.
1. A StartBackup request arrives to the service.
2. Current index operations should finish in the current folder.
3. Open a new temp index folder (partial), new write operations work there.
4. Old directory is copied (LocalIndex_backup_timestamp)
5. Merge temp folder to old one. (Lucene api?)
6. Reopen old folder and continue writing there.
7. Delete temp folder (if lucene doesn't delete it itself)

A new api should also provide backup info (last backup, current status).
